intro: Fagara consolatae, commonly known as the Jamaican starapple, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica, and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, Fagara consolatae is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
